website_summaries.verdict: Popular under-seat bicycling saddle bag, durably constructed of reflective material and available in sizes small, medium, or large.
pros: Constructed from 3M Scotchlite reflective material, with hook-and-loop attachment straps
Includes a taillight hanger for safe riding in low light
Medium and large size saddle bags are expandable for added carrying room
Bag is designed with an internal hook and mesh netting for keys, for added security
cons: The hook-and-loop under-seat attachment strap is longer than some buyers desired, making snug attachment of the bag difficult without somehow adjusting

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the medium size. When I first opened the box I was taken aback by the size. I was expecting something larger. However when I started putting stuff inside I was pleasantly surprised how much stuff fit inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great seat bag.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the smallest version of this bag and it fits comfortably under my road bike seat. It is very well made, has ample storage for my needs (Nitrogen tube filler system, spare nitrogen canister, spare tire, chap stick, and emergency cash, and sturdy tab on the back for my bike strobe light). Great bag, and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Leftside HeavyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Cheap straps make this a no go for trail riding
customer_reviews.text: Nice size but the straps are too cheaply made to be a good buy. Bought the XL size and it easily had enough room for spare tube and CO2 plus a little plastic bottle of chain oil. Rode with it maybe 6 times before the cheap straps gave way. The straps wouldn't stay tight and the movement caused the primary support strap to wear quickly. The post strap is fixed on to the bag and doesn't wrap well enough around the seat post to be completely secure. My last seat pack was way better quality and lasted 15 years, but just a bit too tight on space. See pics.
customer_reviews.author: Shake-n-Bake

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size & Configuration for Road Bike, Surprisingly Good Quality.
customer_reviews.text: This hangs below the seat on my Trek carbon fiber road bike. It's a size Large. If I had to I could cram a light windbreaker into it along with my tube and tools. Pros: • It's just the right size for a spare tube, some tools, etc. • Build quality is excellent (especially for the cost; it's a serious bargain) • Strapping system is secure—it doesn't wobble • Strap on the back holds a standard rear light (which I use strobing in the daytime on roads) • Rear opening is easy and well positioned • Key retainer clip is strap-attached inside. Cons: None.
customer_reviews.author: Ryga

customer_reviews.title: Lesson learned after first ride
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made and although it can expand, I'm not sure how you could use that feature, it sits fairly close to the rear wheel...where I found my main problem. The strap that holds it up to the seat is a friction strap and the funny noise I started hearing while riding my bike was the pack slowing sliding down onto the back wheel..which wore a hole in the bottom before I figured it out. It still held stuff though, and when I got home, I redid the connection with a giant Zip tie. I have it working now..but if you like your things nice and new...do something about the top connection BEFORE your first ride.
customer_reviews.author: Ed's Eco Adventures

customer_reviews.title: Not good for phone
customer_reviews.text: We need a pack that will hold a tool, a couple snacks, ID and keep our phones safe while riding. While this does have an expansion area, the pack narrows down to less than 2 inches, making phone storage darn near impossible (unless you own one from a decade ago when small phones were all the rage). Probably a great pack for true bikers, who wear phone on their back in their shirt pocket, but not for casual neighborhood and trail riding where you're gone for just a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: UK Wildcats Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fair at best
customer_reviews.text: When my seat bag arrived I was sure it was the Small although I ordered a Medium. But no, it was actually a "Medium" but it was small to me. Can't fit much in there except the bare necessities for changing a flat. No room for a cellphone, car keys or any first aid supplies except for a few band-aids. It also has a strange and difficult strap system and I can't really get it to stay straight. It hangs to one side or the other. In other words, lopsided. I waited too long to set it up so I couldn't return it, but I would've if I could've.

customer_reviews.title: Installation help? Here ya go!
customer_reviews.text: The trick to the strap on the installation is to "split" one strap to each side of the support beams under the seat. Don't pass the entire strap through the support beams of your seat. Like the photos, the logo should read correctly sitting under the seat and not be upside down. I don't think it would have killed them to attached a simple diagram, given the test if the effort on the product page. Attached some photos to help. I can only assume the loops and stuff hanging off are for other accessories.
customer_reviews.author: mdeguzis

customer_reviews.title: Nice extra pocket when riding
customer_reviews.text: This seat bag performs exactly as expected and described. It is not a place to carry home groceries but is fine for small tools, a wallet, rag/towel, etc. The one drawback I found was that if your seat post is on an angle or otherwise not extending exactly straight up from the frame, the bag does not have a good fit and needs to be tweaked for a secure hold. The straps with a buckle attached also seem to have been strangely attached. But for the price, it works fine and, despite the minor quirks it's a safe buy.
customer_reviews.author: Penn Gname

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: As of right now I have absolutely no problems with this bag. Install on my bike was simple as two straps. I got the medium and without expanding it I was able to fit a 26x2 spare tube, tire tools an Allen key set, patches and even a spare tube of chapstick(that wind will catch you off guard sometimes). I like that it has the reflective strip going around it and the little loop on the front to hook things on to. I plan on getting a tail light that I can clip to it. I just hope it's durable.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier S.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: A nice, inexpensive upgrade for holding your stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this one because it expands from the bottom. It's large enough to hold my wallet, car keys, cell phone, Topeak Alien II bike tool, a foldable water dish for my dog, and his leash for when he gets to open the throttle. Lots of storage, I haven't run into any water intrusion issues but the zipper is just a zipper; it's not a water resistant type so if you get caught in some hefty rain, your stuff gon' get wet. I have seen some comments about it flopping around but the vertical strap is adjustable; you can tighten it down to keep the side to side sway to a minimum. I've not had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: David Jonas

customer_reviews.title: and grabbing large and it is PERFECT. I can fit small tool kit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the medium sized bag first.. and it was slightly to small. Ended up throwing that on the gfs bike, and grabbing large and it is PERFECT. I can fit small tool kit, patch kit, first aid kit, iphone 7 plus, and my wallet.. without expanding. secures under seat great. Quality is great for price as well. STOKED!
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Menke

customer_reviews.title: Worn Out After Only 3 Months of Mountain Biking
customer_reviews.text: If you only ride your bike once in a while this product will do what you need. If you ride regularly especially off-road this thing will wear out quickly on you. I’ve only had this for a few months and it already has a hole worn in it and is starting to fall apart. For more hardcore riders I recommend going with a higher end product that is waterproof and more durable. I’m going to put this one on my spare beater bike. It still functions, but it can’t take many more mountain rides.
customer_reviews.author: K. G

customer_reviews.title: Well made but poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but the strap is poorly designed. It buckles right underneath the seat where it’s almost impossible to get your fingers at it. And the buckle is the wrong way around so you can’t just pull on the end of the strap to tighten it. You have to take a guess at the length, try to buckle it, take it out, adjust again, etc until you get it right.
customer_reviews.author: BobMG

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Bike Bag Option
customer_reviews.text: These under-seat bike bags are very similarly designed, and the BV is similar to the other brands available but at a cheaper price. Construction quality is good and looks like it will hold up quite well. It has a zippered expanding pocket just as its competitors do, which makes it a bit more versatile for occasional larger loads. I purchased the large size for a hybrid bike with a larger seat and I put a heavy duty Kryptonite lock in it and it fits snugly. The large size is probably too big for a narrow road bike seat.
customer_reviews.author: ProConsumerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought BV Bicycle Saddle Bag in large size for $7.27 on July 6, 2018. The bag feels well-made and fits everything (keys, phone, etc.) without any issues. Based on what other reviewers said, maybe I would have been okay with just the small size, but the large size was what was on sale when I got it. The strap around my bicycle feels sturdy, and I like that I am able to attach a taillight directly on the bag. Overall, this is a really nice bag, and I would recommend this to anybody looking to strap a bag to their bicycles.
customer_reviews.author: Huh

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the low price
customer_reviews.text: Small but expandable and just fits all of my tool kit, spare tube, mini pump and bike lock. I've read other reviews that have said that the strap comes away due to weak stitching. My strap was long enough to go around the bag and my saddle stays, everything that I have in there is for emergencies only, so not a problem for me. It stays on the bike no problem and doesn't move around at all, if it's put on properly, as it shown in the product photo and my attached photo.
customer_reviews.author: R B W

customer_reviews.title: Great and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Great cheap saddle bag. I got the large size. Fits both our 26 inch and 24 inch mountain bikes, though cannot use the extended compartment on the 24 inch because the seat is too low (rider is short). This is not the products fault. Unextended, there is plenty of storage for wallet, keys, phones, etc., and thats what I wanted. I would buy again, but they seem sturdy enough to last a good long while.
customer_reviews.author: Free88Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: I got both a large bag and a medium bag. I wanted the smallest bag that I could still fit a 29er tube and all my tire repair stuff in, including my Crank Brothers Small pump. It turn out the medium bag, with the bottom un-zipped and expanded, is approximately the same size as the large bag with the bottom zipped up. Therefore, I can fit all my stuff in either bag. However, I like the large bag much better because the expanded material is much thinner than the heavy material the main bag is made of. The expandable section would be fine for carrying extra stuff in emergencies, but I personally would not want to use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Illya Kuryakin

customer_reviews.title: Good saddle bag for price
customer_reviews.text: The small bag fits perfectly under a mountain bike saddle. I have a multi tool, 2 tire levers, tube repair kit, and a tire pressure gauge and still have room. There is a small net on the lid that keeps my presets adapters from bouncing around most of the time, but doesn’t secure them that well. -1 star because it is hard to install tight against the saddle. The clip is hard to tighten, so I tied the extra strap (there is a lot) to the saddle rails to hold it tight.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit my bike and is low quality.
customer_reviews.text: This bag was poor quality and didn't fit my 29" tire mountain bike. When installed correctly, the pack angles downward, unlike depicted in the pictures, and it rubbed my tire. I was able to install it upside down, so it would be angled upward, but then you can't use it in the extended configuration. The strap also started to unravel just from installation. I think I'll try a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag, may not work so well with full-suspension bikes
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a convenient place to put a small bike tool kit, car keys, and even a cell phone. It worked great on my hard-tail bike. When I upgraded to a full-suspension bike it will rub with suspension compression, and especially if used in the expanded size. It is also not very compatible with a dropper seat post. That said, if you ride a hard-tail this is a very nice setup.
customer_reviews.author: Flyinlow

customer_reviews.title: I love this little saddle
customer_reviews.text: I love this little saddle. It sits on the backside of the bike under my seat above my back tire. I ordered a large and it's large enough to hold my small pump, spare tubes, a tube repair kit, and a few other little things like my sunglasses and bike gloves. I also love that it drops down into a larger size. I can imagine a large would only work if your bike seat was raised a pretty good distance. It also doubles to protect my backside of water and mud flying up. I love the little strap that can have a rear bike light attached to it. It is well designed and well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Go with small for just an emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: Pretty stylish as far as saddle bags go. Reflection strips on all sides which is nice. Definitely get the small size for just essential flat repairs. I have 2 C02 cartridges, a small C02 inflator head, a tiny pack of patches, three tire levels, and some cloth for wiping in there. I think I could fit a spare inner tube as well, it wouldn't be an issue. Probably couldn't fit 2 spare inner tubes. I was debating medium vs small size, and I'm super glad I got the small.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Bobo

customer_reviews.title: A MUST for your bike!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this bag! I bought one last year and this year started riding longer rides so needed another one. I’m hypoglycemic so need to bring a cpl snacks and sugar tabs along with my bike stuff. I have one in front and then one under my seat. I highly recommend this bag!!!
customer_reviews.author: Moms

customer_reviews.title: Medium is too small to fit a larger screen iPhone
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 2 stars because the quality is great, but I ordered in a medium with the anticipation that it would fit my iPhone 10 X max, but it does not. Disappointing since it took well over a week to arrive. I am exchanging for the Large, which will hopefully work. Have to wait almost a week for that as well. This pouch is very well made and seems durable, but if you’re wanting to put a larger screen phone in it, go with the Large.
customer_reviews.author: Cocktailpeanut

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality, Way smaller than it looks
customer_reviews.text: Buckle to attach to bottom of seat was assembled up-side-down, making it impossible to fasten. Front velcro strap way too short to go around seat post. The medium size I ordered was super small. No way a bike lock would fit into it. Apparently these people never tried to use their own product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Good under your seat saddle bag
customer_reviews.text: Good under the seat saddle bag that holds a reapir kit, my XL phone (in a Otter box case). Keeps contents dry from water flying up from the rear wheel. Reflective trim improves visibility at night. Fits good to my Fuji Absolute but a more difficult fit to my Marin Mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hansel

customer_reviews.title: Very Roomy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very big bag. That is nice because it is able to fit everything we need to have with us on the road. The only problem is that it is hard to fit our tail light on the bike now because it takes up so much room. However, this is as advertised and definitely convenient.
customer_reviews.author: FavreLover

customer_reviews.title: Quality, convenience, stylish at an Awesome price
customer_reviews.text: The BV saddle bag is my first saddle bag. When I saw it on Amazon I thought that it looked nice but it probably wouldn’t be as nice as a high end bicycle company saddle bag. I was wrong. This saddle bag is extremely nice. It has reflective trim and lots of room. It has a durable nylon(?) strap to clip a taillight to. I’ve used panniers on a rear rack for a long time but when I don’t need all the bulk and weight of panniers this BV saddle bag will carry the essentials. Of course, the panniers and/or a backpack will carry lots of groceries but on non-grocery days this BV bag does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: My only slight disappointment is the rear light strap
customer_reviews.text: This saddle bag has a lot of room. When expanded, it holds an extra tube, CO2 air pump and two cartridges, a tool set, including tire levers and patches, cell phone, small wallet and large set of keys, with some room to spare. When the bag is this loaded, it's a bit heavy, but it has everything you need to feel safe out on the road. My only slight disappointment is the rear light strap. My rear light doesn't fit a snugly as I'd like, but it can still be seen. I wish it were adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Mickie

customer_reviews.title: Well built but dimensions are wrong
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Medium size bag. Quality material and construction. But measures smaller than in description. Maximum width only 3.0 inches and tapers down to an even narrower 1.5 inches at other end. Will not hold my iPhone, which was the main purpose of buying this bag. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Utilitarian bag but zipper broke after less than a year
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this bag and it's ability to expand. I also like key ring clip and pocket and the ability to clip on a taillight on the front. But after just a few months of use with a protein bar, keys, and bike lock, the zipper broke. Unable to figure out how to contact manufacturer/determine if this is covered in the warranty. Ultimately bought it again because the size and price is right.
customer_reviews.author: ESB

customer_reviews.title: A must for mountain bikers!
customer_reviews.text: I was riding down some single-track on my mountain bike and got a pinch-flat on a rock in the middle of the trail. If I didn’t have this little bag under my seat filled with an extra tube and tools, I would have had a nice 2.5 to 3 mile walk back home, including down the mountain. Really handy, especially if you don’t want to wear a backpack. I have the medium size, which when expanded actually holds 2 inner tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Neumeier

customer_reviews.title: Very resistent, reflective, a lot of room to carry stuff
customer_reviews.text: Good price, easy to mount, the medium size is perfect for MTB, you can carry a tube, multi tool, patch kit, car keys, some money, zip ties, and a lot of extra stuff even without opening the bottom zipper. I recommend to pass a little wire or something between the main zippers to avoid them of opening in the middle of the road, I used one "plastic covered wire" that comes in the bread bags of the supermarket and never have any more problems.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Nice in large.
customer_reviews.text: I had the medium before but returned it. The large hold MUCH more, and is only like 15% bigger on the outside. Easily (without cramming) hold my phone, and all my bike tools. On the medium one, I had to cram my phone in on the very bottom and I would have to stretch the bag. Much much happier with the large and it's only $2 more. HIGHLY recommended you get the LARGE if you use this on a mountain bike/street bike. Medium should suffice on a road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P

customer_reviews.title: Great under the saddle bag
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bag. It fits under my saddle very well and holds everything that I needed without having to expand it. The construction looks very good and I hope it lasts for a long time. It holds and extra tube, a tube repair kit, a multi tool, gloves, co2 cartridges and the filler head, rubber gloves, tire tools, wet wipes, bandages and I still have a little room left.
customer_reviews.author: W. T. Traylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice form factor. Required fixing to stay on Mtn bike.
customer_reviews.text: I hold my iPhone 6, first aid kit, car key and tool in this with no problem. I have the medium size bag. It is a tight fit but I can zip it up fine. After riding 2 times the fabric started ripping on the strap that holds it onto the bike seat. I ended up making a ziptie/tape contraption to keep the strap together as it was unraveling itself. I also safetypin the zippers together because the rough mountain bike trails can make the zippers begin to ease apart from each other. Its a decent bag itself but it has its flaws.
customer_reviews.author: SkIan

customer_reviews.title: Best Customer Service Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This company is amazing! My return window closed on me because my bike was on back order and they went above and beyond to hook me up! Not to mention this little bag holds literally everything. I cannot say enough good things about this product and especially about this company. A+++++++. I would rate 10 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: super happy with it
customer_reviews.text: holds my spare tube, tire levers, cO2 cartridge and parch kit easily, while still leaving room for some energy gels and my keys without expanding it. I love it because I can still expand it if I grab extra energy bars. Plenty of room for my tastes, without being too big for the back of the bike. Also it's pretty easy to take off, I use a luggage rack and a bigger bag most of the time, but for fundraising rides that have rest stops, I take the luggage rack off the back and use this. Only takes a minute or two to put on or take off.
customer_reviews.author: Review Chick

customer_reviews.title: Large BV Bicycle Strap-On Bike Saddle Bag
customer_reviews.text: I have a medium Topeak bag on one of my bikes so I definitely knew I wanted a large bag on the second bike. Good material and well made. There is a bi-directional zipper on the opening, and an attachment loop sewn on the bottom. I have not had to use the expansion feature. There is enough room for me to carry a patch kit, spare tube, tire levers, tire gauge, spoke wrench, chain tool, spare keys, and an allen wrench set, and there is still a little room in there.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Reed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit under the seat
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't decide what size to order, worry the large is too big for my bike saddle but after reading some of reviews, I ordered Large size since only $1.50 different and with expansion. I'm so pleased with both quality and the size (L). It fitted perfectly under the saddle. I wrapped the strip over/under the seat clamp. It's so stable and secured. Highly recommend if you're looking for a good quality of seat bag.
customer_reviews.author: collyW

customer_reviews.title: Great Minimalist’s Bag
customer_reviews.text: If you are a minimalist, the small is the perfect size. I initially bought both a small and medium. The medium was too big for my needs. The small easily holds a spare tube, patch kit, tire levers and a Topeak Mini 9. It also has a small mesh compartment for some cash, a small clip to hold your keys and a loop on the outside to attach a light. It does NOT unzip at the bottom like the medium and large. The best thing about the small is that it fits perfectly under my saddle. You can barely notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Kayaker61

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and size
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new bike seat pouch that would fit my phone and I found one! The large is long enough to fit my phone, keys, mask, and patch kit. The reflective material and light look work great too. I will probably buy another one for my other bike. The only negative is that I feel the material could be thicker, but time will tell if it wears well.
customer_reviews.author: charshew

customer_reviews.title: Measurements given were deceiving.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to carry small things while I bike, like my keys, phone and ID. The bag came in three sizes so I measured my phone to make sure it would fit since it's the one thing I always carry. According to the description the measure was a good fit with a little room to spare for keys and whatnot. However, the bag tapers on the end and my phone sits on a diagonal and uses all the available space. I thought the bag would have the same dimensions in the back as they do in the front. I will be sending this bag back.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Reed

customer_reviews.title: No Complains except having to remove them
customer_reviews.text: These bags work perfectly and as advertised. I love that they expand, so I can shove my out layer that inevitably gets shed sometime during my ride every time, and still fit my iPhone 8 Plus, tire levers, multi-tool, keys, and AirPods case. The only complain I have is when I have to take it off to switch bikes, etc. It's a pain in the butt, since you have to thread the nylon strap through the saddle underneath. The velcro strap is easy that connects to the seatpost, but the saddle threading can make me crazy at times. Otherwise, love this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jakis Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the large and it was the perfect size. Its a bigger than that "ideal" minimalistic look but I would rather have the functionality and storage. In the large I have a spare tube, tire levers, multi tool, spare derailleur hanger, patch kit, AND A CABLE LOCK! (without the extension) There might even be room for more stuff. Its the perfect size. I love it. I cant speak to the water resistance because I havent taken it out in the rain but seems like it would be fine. Good buy, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T. Williams

customer_reviews.title: straps need to be designed better
customer_reviews.text: Ordered medium for wallet, phone and keys. I wish it was a little longer. Also, I couldn't strap it tight enough because the buckle kept coming in the way. It keep dqngling a bit. But overall it's good.
customer_reviews.author: Colorful

customer_reviews.title: I love bike accessories
customer_reviews.text: I love bike accessories! This bag is great for the price. I purchased the med bag and it is perfect for my 17.5 frame on 29’s. I fit one inter tube c02 pump and cartridge multi tool in it. There’s still plenty of space left, enough for keys/cash and possibly one more tube. Quality of material is really good. It has strap for light on the rear side of the bag. No complaints really. Awesome bag for the price. If this review was helpful please click on the helpful link, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Limon

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
customer_reviews.text: I am an experienced biker. I bought this to go with a new bike. On a recent ride, the zipper came apart and dumped my cell phone, wallet, keys, and bike tool somewhere along a 7-mile trail. It took me over 6+ hrs of walking the trail to recover the keys, wallet, and phone. Never found the bike tool. Consider what it would cost to replace your cell phone, keys, or wallet and buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Marko

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: Looks are deceiving. This is built extremely well, it looks durable, and made with quality materials....however.....its TOO SMALL!!! This is the 3rd saddlebag I've tried from Amazon and when I got and opened it, I laughed. Please, who's making these things so small. Nothing of any worth is going to fit in it. Better off just using a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: ThisIslandEarth

customer_reviews.title: Great form factor and utility, the best!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag - I first got a Medium but returned it in favor of a large - even on my lightweight road bike the form factor is compact and it is narrow enough not to interfere with my legs. The Large easily fits a mini-pump inside, as well as two tubes, a patch kit, two infiltrator cartridges - everything you need. On a longer ride you can expand it and put you wallet and phone in there too. The reflective stripe in the back is very conspicuous and the strap works great for securing my red taillight to the bag. Definitely 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Valente

customer_reviews.title: Hard to attach the rear light
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit smaller than I anticipated but it appears well-made. I had to take it off because it interfered with the attachment for my rear light. The little strap/hook on the back does not work for my light (and I suspect most lights) because most of the lights I've seen attach with a rubber hook that stretches to attach to one of the holes around the seat stem. If I can figure out how to use this without having to buy another rear light, I'll be happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Medium Saddle Bag
customer_reviews.text: Cool product. I bought a medium size. Fits my Xs bike frame for my road bike. The clamp cord that attach to the saddle is sort of long and i wish It’s a little smaller so it doesn’t have space between the saddle. It sort of moves even though i made It tighter when i ride A bike. Cool thing about this bag is the space. The bottom zipper can be open and the main space expands. You can put a good amount of items. I dont Have an extra tubes yet so I’m not sure if it fits. Hoping it does. 3.5 stars out of 5 because of the zipper and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Arpee Caballes

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this pack but was not extremely impressed once I mounted it on my bike. It works much better for a male bike than a females bike, I will say that for certain. My husband and I purchased them to keep our bike locks in there but I ended up just using my backpack to store my lock as this bag kept falling down and interfering with my wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Tay C.

customer_reviews.title: Just received product. Bag is ok but the clasp ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received product . Bag is ok but the clasp they give you to secure to your seat is very cheap. In fact it doesn't work so if you attach bag to seat expect to see it dangling behind you and don't let it dangle for to long or it will get caught up in your rear tire. Not sure why they would choose such a cheap plastic clip they won't lock but that's what it is. When you couple that with amazon sand bagging delivery for three working days so you won't get it too soon unless you use prime make it hard to give more than a single star. Sorry guys if you buy this you'll have problems
customer_reviews.author: sman

customer_reviews.title: Does not attach well to the seat post.
customer_reviews.text: The review if for size L. The bag is good and attaches to the saddle fine. My complaint is about the idiotic design of the retention strap that goes around the seat post. The part of the Velcro that has “hooks” is very short and is located on the end of the strap making it impossible to secure it tightly around the standard MTB seat posts.
customer_reviews.author: Doberman

customer_reviews.title: tiny
customer_reviews.text: it looks good on picture but my cell does not fit in it :( that was the point to it!
customer_reviews.author: L. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well built, compact
customer_reviews.text: Just got the medium put on my bike today. I'm impressed with the overall construction of the bag, I wish when you opened it, that the "door", for lack of better words, would drop down a little lower for easier access, but perhaps in time. Looks to me like it'll do what I needed, I did think the medium would've been a bit bigger, but no worries. Note, I have a Samsung galaxy s7 edge with a fairly small case on it, and it just barely fits.
customer_reviews.author: Rambler

customer_reviews.title: Small, and perfectly formed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the small version to fit under my saddle. It just holds the right amount of stuff. Inner tube, tire levers, 2 CO2 canisters, CO2 Valve, and patch repair kit (all just) but I don't need any more to be carried. Well priced, and well made. I would recommend it as long as you didn't need to carry too much.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size Saddle Bag
customer_reviews.text: I really like this saddle bag. Great size for carrying a spare tube, a couple small tools, tire gauge, wallet, cell phone and keys. The only thing I would change is that I wish the straps attaching to the seat had quick release buckles instead of velcro making it easier/quicker to take off. Otherwise an awesome bag.
customer_reviews.author: cbHoo

customer_reviews.title: This would probably be a good bag if you have a back seat that has ...
customer_reviews.text: This would probably be a good bag if you have a back seat that has something underneath it to which the buckle strap can be attached. My seat does not so I have secure both the velcro strap and the buckle strap to the seat adjustment bar which means the bag swings around quite a bit. Not only that, I bought the medium size and again, I can't help but compare it to a previous bag which was so roomy that I could put phone, wallet and even carry some small item groceries home in (like protein bars) - this one, I have to jam-pack my phone and wallet into and no room for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: LuvBritTV

customer_reviews.title: Great saddle bag, not expandable, though.
customer_reviews.text: I love this saddle bag. I had one for years that recently got demolished by a hungry racoon trying to get to my energy bars. The raccoon won, so I had to get a new one! The only caveat: the site says it has a zipper pocket that you can use the expand the bag. It doesn’t. For me, that’s fine as I wanted the one without the expander, but you might want to order the larger size if that’s important to you.
customer_reviews.author: FlexiDan

customer_reviews.title: This is the saddle bag to buy
customer_reviews.text: When I was looking in the store at saddle bags, another customer veered me away from the choices in the store and recommended I look elsewhere. She suggested looking for a saddle bag that clipped vs velcro as the primary means to hold the bag in place. I found this and what a great purchase. It hold my multi-tool and 2 tubes with room to spare. The rear light piece isn't going anywhere anytime soon. I think this saddle bag is built for the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: Casper

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and value. Purchased the medium and large size for my road bike and the large fit very well with and improved storage space. For $1 more keeping the large was the way to go. Both the medium and large fit very well under road bike seats so why not just go for the large. Excellent product. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: CharlieKnows

customer_reviews.title: Great saddle bag...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the small bag, I'm able to fit my keys, debit and credit cards with plenty of extra space. I could fit tools and other small items if necessary. You can still see my reflector and there's plenty of clearance for my tire. I haven't installed my brake light yet, but there is a spot for it on the bag which is pretty convenient. The bag is also pretty secure, it doesn't rotate or move around. My previous bag moved around a lot which is why I had to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Niecy

customer_reviews.title: durability, storage capacity, and functionality
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 2.5 years now and I don’t ride, and can’t imagine not having this LARGE size bag on rides. Plenty of room for ride essentials. It’s expandable and this feature allows me to cram everything I need for long rides in this bag. I did spray with water repellant twice over the last couple years and it still works great. 5 stars for durability, storage capacity, and functionality. Oh! And co$t. So inexpensive for such a valuable item to have on rides!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic under-seat bag
customer_reviews.text: I actually left mine open by accident for a quarter mile, completely unzipped. Given the fact my keys, wallet, vape, repair kit and multitool all stayed safe inside even with such grotesque oversights I have to give this 5 stars. And if you think that's impressive try it zippered. Wow, such secure
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Shore

customer_reviews.title: * easy to use * good features including useful expansion zipper ...
customer_reviews.text: PROs: * easy to use * good features including useful expansion zipper * large size fits 5.5" smartphone, wallet, wrenches, tire tools, spare components, a snack or two. CONs: * clip strap is hard to tighten all the way, bag will inevitably shake and rattle a bit over rougher terrain * my bag developed a torn hole in a seam within 3 months under normal MTB use
customer_reviews.author: uhnonimuss

customer_reviews.title: Small but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So, I should have paid attention to how big this actually was and I didn't. It was much smaller than I imagined. That's on me, though. It's very sturdy, fit nicely and will work for what I needed it for, a place to fit keys and small first aid kit. Overall, it was a good buy and I received it quickly. I would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large
customer_reviews.text: Large is clearly a misnomer, albeit the dimensions are clearly indicated in the description. Very pleased with this purchase and recommend it, but be sure the dimensions meet your needs. It went on easily and securely. I was able to put my phone, keys, wallet, and ear bud case in it. This, however, did fill it up.
customer_reviews.author: W J O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: My favorite saddle bag
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite saddle bag. I can fit everything I need in here, especially with it expanded. I usually have small tool, cable lock, keys, and wallet. If I’m going more adventurous, there’s still enough room for a patch kit, co2 inflator/cartridge, and maybe another extraneous small thing or two. If I really Tetris it, I can get my iPhone X in there with all the standard stuff, but that usually goes on a stem mount.
customer_reviews.author: dngn0

customer_reviews.title: Quality, well-designed seat bag
customer_reviews.text: perfect for my Cannondale road bike to hold tools and tire repair gear (wrenches, CO2 cartridges, repair kit, 4.2 lever set and inflator); expandable to hold my phone and wallet. It was a larger size because the bike wrench included with my bike was on the long side (6"). would recommend and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Sato

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This is bag is great. In it I have a patch repair kit, one extra tube, a multi tool, 2 decent sized lights, those little plastic shims for removing tire, and a snack. The only security feature is you removing it from your bike if you leave it locked up. It’s easy to remove once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Switzer

customer_reviews.title: These are a lot smaller than they look!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a medium. Waaay too small. Dimensions listed appear to be on the outside, not the inside. The pic included shows a medium bag with an IPhone 8+ with a wallet case. Big phone? Yes. I had hoped by taking advantage of geometry and angling the phone it would work out, but even with the expansion (which is pretty cool) I cant get it to work. Key ring, mesh pocket are all cool. I’m hesitant to order the large as I’m not convinced another inch will suffice, but I like the bag overall so I’ll probably order another.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Whaley

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price. Quality bike bag
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a bike bag for a while and different brands. My first impression of the BV bag is really good. Easy to install, good quality material, and it has enough space for a normal size wallet, cellphone and keys. I have not used it yet, but the expandable bottom is a nice plus. Most important, can’t beat the price. I hope this bag will last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kah S

customer_reviews.title: I over tightened the bag due to my increased riding style of rocking the bike like a pendulum on my sprints
customer_reviews.text: Gone through about 250 miles and no issues what so ever with the large saddle bag. Very aero and holds my two spare inner tubes, pump and toolkit with room to spare if i need to expand the bag. OEM setup and new setup with Fizik Antares R1 carbon saddle on a Ritchey WCS Alloy 1 bolt seatpost. I over tightened the bag due to my increased riding style of rocking the bike like a pendulum on my sprints.
customer_reviews.author: Tamago

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag to hold a few items!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the small bag for my Specialized Tarmac. I am able to fit a spare tube, my keys, two tire levers, and an iPhone 6 in the bag. This is all I need for a ride on the bike and everything fits snugly in there. The straps hold the bag nicely in place while I'm riding. It doesn't bounce around or move at all. It also has a small strap on the rear of the bag that I use to clip my flashing red light onto. I would definitely recommend this bag for anyone who needs to hold just a few items such as tube, levers, and phone!
customer_reviews.author: K. Droddy

customer_reviews.title: May not work well for every seat.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that it holds a lot of stuff. I got a tube, tools and my wallet and keys inside the medium sized bag. The problem I had was trying to get the strap fastened under my seat. Because one side of the strap is so short, the clip ends up being directly under my seat which makes it hard to fasten and unfasten. The two straps aren't enough to keep it from flopping sideways which is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bag (revised)
customer_reviews.text: The bag is impossible to tighten under the seat since the buckle is backwards on the strap. Strap would need to be cut in order to reverse the orientation of the buckle. Won't hold a smartphone either. Returning. Revising this review after watching a YouTube video demonstrating the installation of a similar bag. Instructions would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: solid product
customer_reviews.text: been using it for a few months now. It has lasted many rides and has a fair amount of storage for my galaxy s9+ cell and multitool and snacks
customer_reviews.author: Andrew_G

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag, medium size worked well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag. The medium size worked well for me. This is for my road bike, so I don't want anything bigger than it needs to be ... but I also need room for stuff. I like the zipper at the bottom that lets the bag expand further when needed ... so that's like having the best of both worlds .. although I would prefer to exchange that feature with a dedicated phone compartment ... as I go caseless and don't want the other items in my bag scratching it ... but I'm weird like that.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Smothers

customer_reviews.title: Great for phone, money, etc.
customer_reviews.text: We needed a way for our son to carry a phone with him while out and about on his bike. This is the PERFECT size for his iPhone 5 and still has room for a few other items. It doesn't stick out past the seat and there's no interference at all. Great addition to his adventures.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Small is smaller than small.
customer_reviews.text: The measurements given are.....not helpful compared to actual product. The claimed width of 3.3 inches is at the opening, it tapers greatly until it is only 1.5 inches wide at the end. This small bag can hold some keys and a wallet or something equally small, but not a cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great bag and fits my iPhone 6-Plus
customer_reviews.text: My old bag just rotted while sitting in the garage so I ordered this one. It is the perfect size and holds my iPhone 6-Plus. It is well built and fits great. At the end of the day, it is just a bag but one worth buying if that is what you are looking for. You can see the reflective stripe in the pic I used with the flash.
customer_reviews.author: Bill O

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Clever Design
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific bike bag - clever design and super-compact. I bought the medium size and am able to store a spare tube, tin of glueless patches, Covid mask, tire removal tool, 3 Allen wrenches, cell phone, key ring with 6 keys, and a George Costanza-size wallet! This is with the bag expanded to full size - but all of that fits in with no problem. I had to look at a YouTube video to see how it attaches; it’s straightforward once you see it but it would have been helpful to have simple IKEA-style illustrations for installation. No instructions included.
customer_reviews.author: DavidA

customer_reviews.title: Love the shape and clips
customer_reviews.text: This bike bag is tons better than the one I used before. I especially love the strap having a clip instead of just velcro to keep it snug to my bike seat. Plus, I like the option to expand the bag to hold more things depending on the length of route I'm riding.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Howell

customer_reviews.title: Great expandable bag for my bike
customer_reviews.text: This bag has plenty of room in it's compact configuration to hold a snack, some basic tools, my phone, and my truck keys while riding. If I need more room I can always expand it, but I haven't had a need to yet. Plenty of room for a spare tire tube if I felt the need (haven't lately).
customer_reviews.author: N1CKV

customer_reviews.title: Well made solid product!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't ridden in the rain with it so I left that feature blank. But I can say this is a really well made product that easily holds a spare tube, inflation canister and valve, patch kit (just in case), small first aid items, hand sanitizer (YUP 2020), tire irons, multi tool and other small items. Perfect if you are hitting the trails and want a quick fix for a flat or first aid. Highly recommend this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Large is perfect size for me
customer_reviews.text: Large is perfect size for me. I can fit CO2 inflator, tire levers, 2 CO2 cartridges, a spare tube and a small multi-toolkit, plus couple patches. That's unexpanded. Might be able to fit cell phone too, but haven't tried. Haven't tried expanding it yet. Seems well made, and fits nicely under seat and hooks to seat post. Easy to open, close. I tried one of those expensive side opening bags, and it was way too small, and ease of opening was not much of an advantage, since I rarely open it (only when I have a flat). Handy loop for clip-on rear light.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Zouck

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay strapped tightly, can't return now either.
customer_reviews.text: Seat stem velcro is tight but the cheap plastic buckle that goes through your seat will not stay tight for anything. Its basically not even usable since it flops around with any weight of items inside. Wish I could at least return for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Gamehendge76

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size.  Well built.  Easy to install.  What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Well built. Easy to install. What's not to like? It snuggly fits a CO2 inflator, 2x16g CO2 cartridges, patch kit, multi-tool, 3 tire levers, iphone 6 & my wallet. If I expand the case, and re-organize a little, I can also get my keys and either a spare 26" tube or a garage door opener in the case. When expanded, the case doesn't just drop down, it angles down (0" gain at the seat tube and about an inch gain where is zips closed), but still supplies a lot of additional storage and doesn't hit my rear tire. This fits everything I need. I don't know why you would need a large bag.
customer_reviews.author: Annette O.

customer_reviews.title: Sizing really small
customer_reviews.text: There is no size chart available..: the small is ridiculously small won’t even hold an iPhone. So then ordered the medium which should be called a small... will squeeze an iPhone in but almost two right to even add a set of keys. They need to update and provide size information!
customer_reviews.author: TGW

customer_reviews.title: Must have for long rides
customer_reviews.text: Fit all my tools needed for on the road repairs including extra tube, co2 cartridge, hex tools, pry tools, etc.. Used this on RAGBRAI, a 7 day ride across Iowa, and I was able to fit everything needed for 2 bike's maintenance, and extra stuff we picked up along the way. The bottom expands, which allows almost 50% more space. I bought the medium bag and it was not too bulky, any smaller would have not fit everything. Has a spot for reflector light on back. Construction is good, still looks new.
customer_reviews.author: BurleyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great little storage addition
customer_reviews.text: So far great addition to my ebike. Holds a ball cap or water bottle, mask, phone, whatever small. Under the seat no problems and zip tied a bike tail light to the strap for such things. Yet to use the interior clip for spare keys but feature rich design and stays put even with the seat constantly removed to charge the bike battery below. Two zippers to the middle is probably the most underestimated perk to any storage bag too.
customer_reviews.author: AFePub

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I got the Medium, and it is the perfect size for a commuter bike emergency kit: 26x2 tube, multi-tool and tire levers. It's snug, so no rattling around. The expand-ability is nice in case you ever need to get a wallet or keys in there too. I would only recommend the small for road bike riders who have super tiny tubes. A full-size tube will not fit in the small
customer_reviews.author: Matt Koz

customer_reviews.title: Works for my criteria. Carriers more, has key clip
customer_reviews.text: Little smaller than the bag it replaced, so can't quite carry as much as in the past. Stuff is really jammed packed in there. I have to take most of it out to get to anything. Seems well made. I ride every day, so we'll see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wohl

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but sun faded in 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I like a lot about this bag, in fact, if I didn't keep my bike outdoors a lot because we live in an RV fulltime, I'd probably give it 5 stars. But the bag faded within 2 weeks of being on my bike and I'm very worried about long-term durability. It's not terrible, but very noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my MTB. I chose size M because I expected to place my Galaxy S6 inside in case of a rain. I normally use it to carry some cash, ID and keys. There was a huge rain during a ride and I finally used it to store my phone without problem. Then I friend was worried of getting his Oneplus 3 wet so I tried using the extension to store both phones and it worked, although a little tight. The phones remained dry during the whole ride even with the terrible weather conditions. I consider this one of the best purchases I've made for my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Andrés

customer_reviews.title: bike pack
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Bigger than my last one it replaced. I like the double zipper. I don't carry much, so it should hold my phone if needed in addition to levers, patch kit & hex wrenches. Clip for keys inside the opening as well as a small net. AAA+++
customer_reviews.author: SVO Cobra
